page.title: 04A TRIP TO BRADGATE PARK.
page.content:
On Wednesday we went to Bradgate Park. I had my boots, ruck sack and my blue Kagoule. We started at 10am. We went across the fields and got to the park at about 11am. We saw the Park Ranger and he told us about the deer. The red deer and the fallow deer and the special white deer. We went to his car and he gave us a fallow deer antler. We went into the ruins where Craig found a peacocks egg. We went into the chapel. The ranger told us about Lady Jane Grey, she had freckles. We had our packed lunches and then we played a game of football. Some of us went to the monument of Old John and the rest went to the village of Newtown Linford. We got backto school at about 5 minutes to four.
By Phillip Hoggar. Aged 9.
